questions.question: It is no fun being a ...............................
questions.description: A guinea pig is essentially a test material.

questions.question: My little girl is always as busy as a ................................
questions.description: If you are as busy as a beaver, you are very busy.

questions.question: I was as hungry as a ................................. after the workout.
questions.description: If you are as hungry as a bear you are very hungry.

questions.question: She was as meek as a .................................. and hence people often took advantage of her.
questions.description: When you are as meek as a lamb, you are very docile or meek.

questions.question: The boy was as nervous as a .................................. when the teacher caught him cheating on the exam.
questions.description: When you are as nervous as a cat, you are very nervous.

questions.question: When we first came to Singapore, we were as poor as church ............................................
questions.description: When you are as poor as a church mouse, you are very poor.

questions.question: I was as scared as a ..................................... when the teacher told me to meet the headmaster.
questions.description: As scared as a rabbit means very scared.

questions.question: He was as sick as a ....................................... when he reached home from work.
questions.description: As sick as a dog = very sick.

questions.question: Beware of him. He is as sly as a ..................................
questions.description: As sly as a fox means very smart and clever.

questions.question: The boy was as strong as a ................................. and lifted the bed with little effort.
questions.description: If you are as strong as a horse, you are very strong.

questions.question: There is no point in talking to her, she is as stubborn as a ......................................
questions.description: When you are as stubborn as a mule, you are very stubborn.

questions.question: We backed the wrong .................................... when we nominated him for mayor.
questions.description: To back the wrong horse is to support someone who is unlikely to win.
